dt: {bc}to imbue with a usually partisan or sectarian opinion, point of view, or principle
{bc}to instruct especially in fundamentals or rudiments {bc}{sx|teach||}

et: probably from Middle English {it}endoctrinen{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}endoctriner{/it}, from {it}en-{/it} + {it}doctrine{/it} doctrine
shortdef: to imbue with a usually partisan or sectarian opinion, point of view, or principle
to instruct especially in fundamentals or rudiments : teach
